info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 1 at 4:39PM MDT until June 1 at 6:30PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne WY
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall and accumulating hail is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of southeast Wyoming, including the following county, Laramie.
* WHEN...Until 630 PM MDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 438 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1.25 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Cheyenne, Cheyenne Regional Airport, Fox Farm-College, North Cheyenne, Frontier Park, Ranchettes and Warren AFB. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 PM MDT THIS EVENING
